context_evidences: - Robert Sefcik, a member of the sports medicine advisory committee, said making the menstrual cycle questions mandatory rather than optional is consistent with national guidelines for sports physicals developed by the American Academy of Family Physicians, the American Academy of Pediatrics, the American College of Sports Medicine and other groups. Reference: https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-desantis-florida-sports-female-athletes-160560972802 published on 2023-02-04 00:04:46

- Gov. Ron DeSantis has publicly signed into law a 15-week abortion ban that shortens by more than two months the current window available to legally terminate a pregnancy. Reference: https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/politics/2022/04/14/desantis-signs-florida-most-restrictive-abortion-law-since-roe-v-wade-governor-mississipi/7291466001/ published on 2022-03-28 00:00:00

- If a physician violates provisions of the abortion ban, they would be guilty of a third-degree felony, punishable by up to five years in prison and a $5,000 fine. Reference: https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/politics/2022/04/14/desantis-signs-florida-most-restrictive-abortion-law-since-roe-v-wade-governor-mississipi/7291466001/ published on 2022-03-28 00:00:00

- The Republican-dominated state legislature had already moved to limit abortion access even before the ruling, passing a bill banning the procedure after 15 weeks of pregnancy. The law took effect July 1, but a challenge to it for violating the state constitution has been appealed to the Florida Supreme Court. Reference: https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2022/09/01/desantis-gop-target-florida-abortion/ published on 2022-09-01 18:07:35

- Ryan Harrison, the association’s spokesperson, confirmed the new recommendations were developed by its sports medicine advisory committee and approved in late January . It will now be considered by the association board of directors at its next meeting in Gainesville from Feb. 26-27. Reference: https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-desantis-florida-sports-female-athletes-160560972802 published on 2023-02-04 00:04:46

- What’s unclear is how far DeSantis and Florida’s GOP lawmakers would go to “expand pro-life protections” and force women to carry their pregnancies if the governor is rewarded with another term. Would they push for a near-ban? Cap it at six weeks? Bar the use of medication to end pregnancies? Arrest women or doctors who defy the law? Reference: https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2022/09/01/desantis-gop-target-florida-abortion/ published on 2022-09-01 18:07:35
correction_response:
This tweet is misinformed. The proposal to monitor menstrual cycles is from the Florida High School Athletic Association, not Governor DeSantis. The association is a private nonprofit, not a state agency under the governor's purview. The proposal is also consistent with national guidelines for sports physicals. While DeSantis has signed a restrictive abortion law, it's not related to the menstrual cycle monitoring proposal. 
https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-desantis-florida-sports-female-athletes-160560972802
https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/politics/2022/04/14/desantis-signs-florida-most-restrictive-abortion-law-since-roe-v-wade-governor-mississipi/7291466001/
note_1_text: The FL High School Athletic Association proposed requiring menstrual cycle information on athletic physical evaluation forms, which is common & consistent with national sports medicine guidelines. The organization is a nonprofit and not controlled by the Governor.    https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-desantis-florida-sports-female-athletes-160560972802
note_2_text: Most states ask these questions for their high school and college preparticipation sports physicals, and have for years.  Many use what is virtually the same form.  It is neither unique to Florida nor new.  For example, here are the forms used by Delaware and California:    https://doewebmaster.wpenginepowered.com/diaa/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2022/03/DIAA-2022-23-Preparticipation-Physical-Form-Packet-rv-3-29-22.pdf  https://www.cifstate.org/sports-medicine/physical_forms/PPE_History_en.pdf

refute_evidences: - AP’S ASSESSMENT: False. The Florida High School Athletic Association is weighing the recommendation from an advisory committee, but no final decision has been made. DeSantis’ education commissioner is a member of the association’s board of directors and the commissioner also appoints three others, but the association is a private nonprofit organization, not a state agency under the purview of the governor’s office. Reference: https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-desantis-florida-sports-female-athletes-160560972802 published on 2023-02-04 00:04:46

- But the proposed mandate hasn’t had final approval, and wasn’t developed by DeSantis’ office. Reference: https://apnews.com/article/fact-check-desantis-florida-sports-female-athletes-160560972802 published on 2023-02-04 00:04:46
tweet_category: Human Rights, Social Issues, and Activism
tweet_text: Just learned that DeSantis wants to monitor menstrual cycles of women. He has about as much right to that info as they have to know his sperm count. Can’t believe I’m writing this but he needs to be called out.We don’t need a big brother governor or President.#voteblue
user_description: Former Democratic U.S. Senator from California.
